context_bundle.summary: Trading bot strategies: Grid bots (range-bound), DCA bots (accumulation), trend-following (momentum), mean reversion (oversold/overbought), arbitrage (cross-exchange spreads).

onboarding.quick_start: Choppy/sideways market = Grid bots. Clear trend = Trend-following. Accumulation phase = DCA. High volatility = Mean reversion. Multiple exchanges = Arbitrage.
common_patterns: Grid bot: Buy low/sell high within range. Profits from volatility, dies in breakouts
DCA bot: Fixed buys on schedule. Best for long-term accumulation, ignores timing
Trend-following: MA crossovers, breakout entries. Profits in trends, whipsawed in chop
Mean reversion: RSI/Bollinger extremes. Profits in ranges, destroyed by trends
Arbitrage: Price differences across exchanges. Low risk, requires speed/capital
known_errors: Running grid bot during strong trend - gets rekt on one side
Trend bot in sideways market - death by a thousand cuts
Insufficient capital for grid spacing - liquidation risk
Ignoring fees - high-frequency strategies eaten by trading costs
No kill switch - bot keeps trading during black swan events
